resources.string: See[k] logs you in with Facebook in order to manage favorite and custom locations. See[k] cannot view your private data or post to Facebook.

The Virginia Tech studio of Design For America is proud to present See[k]\n\n
See[k] aims to help you make informed decisions about your mode of transportation, helping your daily commute and the planet. See[k] began in 2012 as an application project for Virginia Tech students to create an official Design For America studio. Since then, the project has gone through many iterations and team members. The primary focus of the See[k] team is a system of wayfinding signs in and around Blacksburg, VA that provide walking, biking, driving, and possibly bus times for travelling to and from the Virginia Tech campus. We aim to have some signs installed by late 2015.

Version 1.03


 Recent Updates:

 Anonymous Login!!!! You can now continue anonymously when opening the app. Anonymous login still allows creating locations and favorites.

 Sorted locations: Locations will show up in lists based off of how close they are to you



Updates planned and coming soon:

 Anonymous login: so you don't have to login with Facebook if you don't want to

 Frequently used: Locations can be sorted by how often you navigate to them

 Settings: so you can control things like notifications, how your locations are sorted, your profile information, and anything else you think needs to be changed.
